node.title: William Conway, Who Reimagined America’s Zoos, Is Dead at 91
node.description: He sought to conserve wildlife and encouraged zoos to exhibit animals in their natural habitats. But he lost a battle to rename the Bronx Zoo.

node.title: Republicans' Odds to Win Control of House and Senate Improve After 2021 Elections
node.description: Democrats, who are the current majority on Capitol Hill, saw disappointing returns across the country on Election Day.

node.title: Some U.S. cities are giving parents $100 to get kids vaccinated
node.description: Vaccinating all New Yorkers ages 5 to 7 would prevent an estimated 38,000 cases of COVID-19, health officials say.

node.title: Secretary Walsh says new vaccine rules could help up labor participat
node.description: Some people won't come back to work until they feel safe, Walsh said.

node.title: How Can I Dress Fashionably Without Irritating My Skin?
node.description: A reader seeks advice on how to feel stylish while still sticking to safe fabrics.

node.title: Aaron Rodgers Lashes Out About N.F.L.’s Vaccine Requirements
node.description: In a bizarre interview the quarterback conducted while quarantining because of a positive coronavirus test, he said that he was a victim of a “woke mob” and that he had unsuccessfully petitioned the N.F.L. to accept his alternative to being vaccinated.

node.title: Coronavirus Briefing: What Happened Today
node.description: Families reunited.

node.title: 'Sir, Watch Out': Video Shows Elk Charging Man In Town Center
node.description: "Most dangerous and potentially harmful encounters occur because people fail to leave the animals alone or get too close," a Colorado Parks and Wildlife rep said.

node.title: Imprisoned Former Cop Derek Chauvin Appears Via Zoom to Face Tax Evasion Charges
node.description: Derek and Kellie Chauvin are accused of withholding more than $400,000 from their taxes from 2014 to 2019.

node.title: Death Science Says It Had a Contract to Use Vet's Body for Education After Widow's Dispute
node.description: An organization that purchased a cadaver for what it said was educational purposes, used it for public dissection at an event where tickets were sold.

node.title: Glenn Youngkin's Underaged Son Tried Twice to Cast a Ballot in Virginia's Election
node.description: Officials emphasized that the teen did not cast a ballot, make any false statements or violate any election laws in his attempt to cast a ballot.

node.title: Chicago Cop Shot Officer Husband While He Tried to Thwart Her Suicide Attempt: Prosecutors
node.description: "Her husband tried to save her life by reaching for that gun and he was killed as a result of that," Assistant State's Attorney James Murphy said.

node.title: Call for Queensland's disability support workers to be mandated to get COVID-19 vaccine
node.description: Eight-year-old Harrison can't use a mask, wash his hands or socially distance from others to keep safe from COVID-19. But his risk of exposure is heightened because the people taking care of him don't have to be vaccinated.

node.title: Canberra price rises push houses out of reach of first-time buyers, despite government aid
node.description: New buyers say a federal scheme that is meant to help them enter the property market is effectively redundant, as its cap of $500,000 is too low.

node.title: After two coronial investigations into the death of Michael Cross his family are still searching for answers
node.description: Authorities deemed the death of Michael Cross a suicide but his family believe he was murdered.

node.title: The price of carbon hit a record this week. Is Australia cashing in?
node.description: Australian farmers are busy generating carbon credits. They're valuable, but could be worth more.

node.title: SA and Qld tighten border restrictions with NT after Kathrine COVID cases
node.description: South Australia and Queensland tighten border restrictions with the Northern Territory after officials revealed in a late-night press conference that the cluster in Katherine had grown to two. Follow live.

node.title: Triple shooting leaves two dead and one injured in Tasmania
node.description: Two people are dead, and another is wounded, following a shooting in Tasmania's north-west.

node.title: This week on "Face the Nation," November 7, 2021
node.description: Senator Tim Kaine and more appear on Sunday's "Face the Nation"

node.title: Hearing Delayed in Complaint Against Andrew Cuomo Due to 'Potentially Defective' Filing
node.description: The complaint filed by a former Cuomo assistant does not include a sworn statement by the victim, according to the Albany County District Attorney.

node.title: Worst downhill day yet for Peloton stock
node.description: With gyms reopening after pandemic closures, Wall Street fears the race may be over for once-hot home-cycling business.

node.title: Jeopardy! Dodged a Bullet by Not Hiring 'Immunized' Aaron Rodgers as Host
node.description: The Green Bay Packers' quarterback now has to quarantine for 10 days, per the NFL's protocol, after testing positive for COVID.

node.title: Internet Backs Couple Who Received Heat From Neighbors for 'Reverse Trick-or-Treating'
node.description: The couple dressed up and went door-to-door to pass out candy and introduce themselves to their new neighbors.

node.title: When will Americans be able to get a COVID-19 antiviral pill?
node.description: Merck and Pfizer are pursuing emergency authorization for pills to treat COVID-19.

node.title: The fatal encounter at the center of the Arbery murder trial was captured on cellphone video.
node.description: By Audra D. S. Burch

node.title: Multiple Yale University Buildings Threatened With Bombs
node.description: The threats had targeted at least seven facilities across the Yale campus in New Haven, Connecticut.

node.title: Colin Powell remembered as a leader, father and friend at funeral
node.description: Former Secretary of State Colin Powell was the first Black American to hold that position and other high-ranking jobs in Washington.
